channel.title: The Rolistes Podcast
channel.description:
Welcome among The Rolistes…
We are the proudly London-based producers of Tabletop RPG podcasts showcasing fans across the Channel, the Pond and beyond.
We cross borders, languages, fandoms, game systems and settings with unique discoveries in each episode.
Join us for a mix of discussions, RPG actual plays, travel-diaries, vox-populi, movie reviews, and even music by amazing Creative Commons artists.
Meet independent game designers, popular British publishers, immigrants, travellers visiting London or other random encounters made during our travels.
Our content is for YOU, no matter if you are a seasoned grognard or wannabe players who are about to take their first steps in The Hobby.
We are for those curious about what and how tabletop roleplaying games are played across the World, how players can have wildly different walks of life and interests can be.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Your London-based tabletop RPG shows!

item.title: "Déjà Vu" at CyberConv 2.0 (Part One)
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Welcome to CyberConv'!

Back in March 2020, as France entered its first lockdown, a bunch of TTRPG enthusiasts decided to do something about their favourite conventions getting cancelled. They created their own online convention.

With only a couple weeks of preparation, the first CyberConv' took place in April 2020.

Due to the great success of this first edition, a second one was launched in late November...

...and that's where I recorded the following interviews:

  • Naali, game master for the "Onirique, Le Podcast de l'Imaginaire" who published already several supplements on Dungeon Masters guild;
  • Michaël Ghelfi, successful music and ambiance composer, author of the upcoming "Tempête sur l'Archipel" to be published by Les XII Singes;
  •  Gaël Sacré aka Willox, game designer, and Kinayla from D1000 et D100 who are part of the CyberConv' organisers

Listen, rate or review the show on Podchaser, Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

Please consider contributing to my Patreon, making a modest donation via Paypal or even support your show at no extra cost via your purchases on DriveThru RPG.

item.title: Lloyd Gyan & All the Things We Do Not Talk About - Part Two
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Were are back for the second and final part of our interview with Lloyd Gyan. (check Part One if you have not yet).

We continued our ramblings which included, but were not limited to:

  • The charms and challenges of horror in TTRPG (and why Lloyd has a love/hate relationship to Call of Cthulhu);
  • What is "immersion" in TTRPG (Pandas Talking Games explained much better than me the concept of "Layers of Game");
  • Lloyd's research into the MET (not the NYC museum) as part of his work on "Rivers of London" for Chaosium.

I still do not know who will be our guest in December but, as usual, it will likely be a nice surprise.

In the meantime, you can practice your French through participating the many things that CyberConv 2.0 will offer to French-speaking TTRPG fans on November 27, 18 and 29.

Cheers

Kalum

Businesses, Places, Shops, Organisations & Personalities
Modiphius, TTRPG Publisher
Chaosium, TTRPG Publisher
Metropolitan Police Service informally called the Met, territorial police force responsible for law enforcement in 32 London boroughs
A.C.A.B., slogan associated with dissidents subjected to police brutality
Transport for London (TfL), local government body responsible for the transport system in Greater London
National Health Service (NHS), the publicly-funded healthcare systems of the United Kingdom

Brendan Conway, game designer
AlbaCon, where you'll find a "2020 - A RPG Year In Review Round Table" panel featuring myself and Lloyd

item.title: Film Studies – The Others (We Promise We Won't Spoil Bly Manor)
item.description:
Listen & review on Apple Podcasts. 

Don’t forget to join our newsletter if you don’t want to miss any of our content.

After several months, Film Studies finally awakens from its slumber to celebrate Halloween.

Grab an oil lamp and follow Kalum from "The Rolistes Podcast" into the dark corners of "The Others", a 2001 English-language Spanish film directed and scored by Alejandro Amenábar.

As usual, we review this film and discuss ways it could inspire tabletop RPG adventures, characters or practices.

Our academic team is completed by Dany Roth from "Song vs Song" and "Everyday Horror" as well as Helen Gould from The Rusty Quill.

Tabletop RPG settings systems, setting and luminaries mentioned included:

    • "Curse of the House of Rookwood" by Nerdy Pup Games
    • "Cthulhu Dark" by Graham Walmsley
    • "Occam's Razor" by Stygian Fox Publishing
    • "Ten Candles" by Cavalry Games
    • "Wraith: The Oblivion" by White Wolf
    • "Alice is Missing" by Spenser Starke for Hunters Entertainment
    • "Hârn" by Columbia Games Inc.
    • "Nephilim" by Chaosium and "Nephilim Légende" boxset by Fabrice Lamidey and Frédéric Weil for Editions Mnemos
    • "Fantaji Universal Role-Playing Game" by Anthropos Games
    • "Vampire the Masquerade" by Modiphius
    • "Paris Gondo – The Life-Saving Magic of Inventorying" by Kalum for The Rolistes
    • Samswise Gamegee from Heroes Without Limits
    • Mustang author of the Combat Wheelchair who recently participated to "The Rolistes Present… - A Guide for Parents to Dungeons & Dragons and Tabletop Roleplaying"

Our next episode is already recorded!

It will see the return of Bee from "The Broadswords" and Scott from "Lawful & Orderly". It was such a pleasure to record our episode about Delicatessen. I just HAD to record an episode again with them 

This time, we will cover "Black Cat, White Cat" directed by Emir Kusturica.

Let us know, ahead of the recording, if this movie inspired you some tabletop RPG adventures.

Maybe we will discuss your contribution on the show.

item.title: Lloyd Gyan & All the Things We Do Not Talk About - Part One
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Have you met Lloyd Gyan? Sometimes, it feels that no matter what tabletop RPG convention you attend, you run into him (which is always a pleasure).

Anyway, if you haven't met him here's your opportunity to catch up with this proud employee of Modiphius, freelance writer for Chaosium's upcoming "Rivers of London Roleplaying Game" and co-host of "James & Lloyd Read Indie RPG Blurbs So You Don't Have To".

He also shares with me conflicted memories about a time that kids these days don't know how lucky they are to have dodged it.

I hope many of you will join me at AcadeCon (on  Saturday November 7th or Sunday November 8th) and GROGMEETish (on Saturday November 17th) for a session of my game “Paris Gondo – The Life-Saving Magic of Inventorying“.

Cheers

Kalum

item.title: The Rolistes Present… Virtually Expo “A Guide for Parents to Dungeons & Dragons and Tabletop Roleplaying”
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

This panel is also available in video on the YouTube channel of Virtually Expo.

Dungeons & Dragons and tabletop roleplaying have found unprecedented popularity through movies, TV shows and online content like Critical Role.

Parents might be left to wonder: “What is this thing?”.

Meanwhile, children might find it challenging to explain this hobby.

Parents and children, look no further than our professional panel to inform you.

My panellists will be:

  • Heroes Without Limits – Mustang (She/Her/They/Them)
    Mustang a disabled (hEDS), queer, Dungeon Master/Game Master who works in disability advocacy to improve representation and accessibility in tabletop rolepaying sames such as Dungeons & Dragons. Mustang is a freelance sensitivity reader and writer, founder of and co-producer at the Heroes without Limits community.
  • River Horse Games – Alessio Cavatore (He/Him)
    Alessio is an Origins awards winner who is the co-author of the tabletop roleplaying game “My Little Pony: Tails of Equestria” for River Horse Games. He has also designed or co-designed many board games and miniatures wargames such as The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game, Jim Henson’s Labyrinth: The Board Game and many more.
  • The Goblin’s Chest – Rupert Greyling (He/Him)
    Rupert is an artist, author, creator and owner of The Goblin’s Chest. He works predominantly with children and young people who have suffered trauma and live with various mental health challenges. He currently develops, with a South African NFO, a culturally-sensitive TTRPG for children in local disadvantaged communities. He also recently organised in London the Maximum Inclusion event for children and young people with disabilities, neurodivergency or chronic illnesses.

We hope that you will find this panel both informative and entertaining.

Sidenote, to be informed in advance of any of our future panels, events and shows please join our newsletter!

See you there.

Kalum

item.title: The New Normal (With Jo Winter)
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Meet Jo Winter, author of  "The Fall of Home", "Light Bringers" and contributor to the currently live Kickstarter campaign "The Map of Is Not The Territory".

Together we braved the dangers of the outside world. Hand sanitizer and microphones in hand we fended off the drones, footballs, swans and parrots which lurked in a London park to bring you this episode.

If you would like to try my game "Paris Gondo - The Life-Saving Magic of Inventorying", you have several opportunities to do so: first as part of AlbaCon on October 3rd and 4th, second with The Gauntlet on October 5th.

See you next month for an episode with convention-goer extraordinaire Lloyd Gyan.

Stay safe.

Kalum

item.title: A Fifth Anniversary Under Lockdown
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

The Rolistes has now been running for half a decade!

It's difficult to believe.

This anniversary is also taking place in circumstances that I could not have imagined when I started.

As a result, I don't have any guest to join me to celebrate.

Thankfully, I can call upon the magic of audio editing! This allowed me to have in this episode many guests through various call-backs.

What a journey! I can't wait how things will be by the time the show reaches its first decade.

Thanks, everyone for your support over my first five years as a podcaster.

Cheers.

item.title: Glorantha Before the Plague with David Scott & Ian Cooper
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

I did it!

I finally close with this interview my substantial backlog of episodes recorded well-ahead of their release. 

This last one brings us back to a time before measures were enforced in London to face Covid-19 (hence "before the plague" get it ?).

Please meet David Scott and Ian Cooper from Chaosium who I interviewed at the Chaosium UK Meetup back in March.

After a rather topical plague-focused session of HeroQuest Glorantha, David and Ian spent an hour with me to discuss their journey into tabletop role-playing, Chaosium and of course Glorantha.

Come join us on this path towards the bronze age.

I hope many of you will join me at Virtually Expo for a session of my game "Paris Gondo - The Life-Saving Magic of Inventorying".

Don't forget that we will also hold the "A Guide for Parents to Dungeons & Dragons and Tabletop Roleplaying" panel at Virtually Expo.

Cheers

Kalum

item.title: Trollune, Role Me Like One of Your French Game Shops
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Once again, I took advantage of a family holiday to quickly record a couple interviews in a local game shop.

This time we landed in the French city of Lyon!

Founded in Lyon in 2005 by Louis et Charles Trécourt, Trollune is allegedly one of France's biggest shop (if not the BIGGEST!).

My guests will introduce you better than I can to this much-beloved game shop:

  • Taz wargames specialist later joined by François from their boardgames department and finally Anouk from their bookstore department;
  • After helping out enthusiastic customers, Taz joined us again to tell us about the tabletop RPG Bloodlust and French contribution to the wargames miniature scene;
  • An old friend of the show, Xany, was lurking in a corner of the shop and told us about what he played lately and recommended some geeky places to visit in Lyon (contact him if you are an employer in the robotics industry or a tabletop RPG fan;
  • And finally, we were joined by Sylvain the in-house tabletop RPG expert who had a few French tabletop RPG recommendations for us and who managed to sell me THREE FRENCH GAMES when I planned only to buy one and also had some Nephilim rumours for us.

I hope many of you will join me at the next Gauntlet Community Open Gaming event on July 18th and 19th to play my game "Paris Gondo - The Life-Saving Magic of Inventorying" and other games.

Don't forget to send me your AMA questions ahead of the 5th anniversary of The Rolistes Podcast before July 31st.

Wow, I managed to pull-off three 𝘾𝙖𝙛𝙚́ 𝙍𝙤𝙡𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙚𝙨: 𝙔𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝘾𝙖𝙛𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙖𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙏𝙏𝙍𝙋𝙂 𝘽𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙠 two weeks in a row!

Please meet Logan & Remy from Storm Giant Games.

As they witnessed gaming businesses around them in Ohio at risk due to Covid-19, they decided to launch a virtual event called Crowd Control Expo.

He introduced me to an online convention called #VirtualHorrorCon which will take place from April 3rd to 5th.

All the information about Crowd Control Expo is available at: https://www.crowdcontrolexpo.com/

item.title: Café Rolistes 87 - #CyberConv, the French Online TTRPG Convention with Sollypsys & Axel
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts. You can also download this episode.

Sign up to our newsletter if you don't want to miss any of our content.

Please also subscribe to The Rolistes Youtube Channel, click the "Like" button and write comments.

https://youtu.be/_25k8Xp5mwI

Follow us on Twitch and contribute LIVE with your questions via the chat.

We spare no effort to provide you with quality, albeit technically flawed, content as we bring you the third Café Rolistes of the week.

Today, we are joined by two French rolistes Sollypsys and Axel to discuss about #CyberConv an online convention launched as a response to Covid-19.

Join the Discord of #CyberConv to find out more about their activities: https://t.co/7oeowtgVpq?amp=1

Do not miss The Rolistes Present... panel which will take place as part of CyberConv:

item.title: Café Rolistes 85 - Social Distancing With Jane Hermiston (FYI the recording broke down halfway)
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts. or download this episode.

Sign up to our newsletter if you don't want to miss any of our content.

Please also subscribe to The Rolistes Youtube Channel, click the "Like" button and write comments.

https://youtu.be/GVksiSIxukc

Follow us on Twitch and contribute LIVE with your questions via the chat.

As a result of the Social Distancing measures that I recommend EVERYONE to follow, I won't be able to record in person any Café Rolistes until further notice.

Hence the idea to do things differently until things get better.

I will instead get in touch with fellow community members via conference call and stream it live on Twitch.

Feel free t reach me if you'd like to be one of my guests. I am mainly interested about friendly conversations with fellow Rolistes about how things are going for them at the moment. If you have anything on your heart you'd like to share, do not hesitate to send me a message.

I am aiming to do so on weekdays every two days at around 2pm on our Twitch channel: https://www.twitch.tv/rolistespod

The video will then be uploaded on our YouTube channel:   https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2fGTs_dddRzqemJDagJOe_j_bLk2-ZlL

Finally, the audio will be available here to Rolistes supporting the show via Patreon.

With all of that out of the way, here's our first attempt.

Today, I am joined by Jane Hermiston, founder of London Industry Tabletop Networking. Quite simply we chatted about the current situation and how it impacts The Hobby for us.

Check out her group if you'd like to know more about their activities or to join their online panel on March 27th at 7pm
https://www.facebook.com/groups/2365624363650240/

Don't forget to sign up for our newsletter!

Take care. Be Safe.

item.title: Waiting for D'Amato (a Flash Visit in London by Mel & James from "One Shot")
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Once upon a time, when we still had the pleasure of welcoming worldwide visitors to London, a little tweet informed me that Mel and Jame D'Amato from the One Shot Network were spending some time in our beautiful city!

Microphone in hand, I headed for Waterloo where I spent the evening interviewing our duo of visitors as well as a bunch of their fans:

  • We opened with James D'Amato himself to enquire about what brought him to the shores of London;
  • Craig Burton told us a bit about his own show "The Game Master & Me";
  • Luca, Chris from The Space Jam Continuum and Matt from Merely Roleplayers. Those three fans of One Shot were with me in the figurative queue to chat more with James and Mel;
  • Colin McGinnis who moved to London from Ohio;
  • ...and finally, we finished with both James & Mel with a short night stroll as a farewell.

Thanks, everyone for this lovely evening.

I was great to be brought back then while editing this episode.

As mentioned in the end credit, I am busy developing my first ever game.

It's called "Paris Gondo - The Life-Saving Magic of Inventorying". You can find information about it as well as a sign-up form to join an online session in this post.

It even has a Twitter account already!

I hope to run this game for many of you and that you enjoyed this episode.

In the meantime, take care, stay safe.

Kalum

item.title: The Rolistes Present… "Everything You Never Dared To Ask About Dungeons & Dragons & TTRPGs on Tik ToK"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Also available in video on our YouTube (please subscribe to our channel). 

When I first joined Tik Tok, I felt like…

…but now I’m like…

Long story short, Tik Tok has a LOT to offer to Dungeons & Dragons and Tabletop RPG fans.

You have cosplayers, funny skits (including too many Bard jokes and don’t ask about clams), GMing advice and even lip-synched re-enactment of your favourite actual play TTRPG shows.

But don’t take my word for it, this month’s “The Rolistes Present…” assembled a team to tell you everything about this hip place where you too can hang out:

  • Hanna – Alikai.Wonderland (She/Her)
    Hanna is from Finland and a roleplayer since 2009 and a small-time creator on TikTok since 2019.
    She’s also, as Eloria, a creator active through her local Fenno-Swedish LARP association. Her favourite tabletop game is Dungeons and Dragons, but she also has a soft spot for the World of Darkness setting by White Wolf. On Tik Tok, she mainly focuses on funny little skits and short videos reflecting her characters’ personalities.
  • Kestrel – OtisClues/OatCooki (They/Them)
    Kestrel is from the UK. They are a student filmmaker and amateur musician. They are a Dungeons & Dragons enthusiast since 2017 when they discoverer it through The Adventure Zone podcast. They’ve been DMing ever since, primarily over the internet, and aim to make any game they run a space where anyone and everyone feels welcome.
  • Robin – Robin_Roulette/Roulette_Cos (They/Them)
    Robin is a UK-based Cosplayer and DnD nerd. They have been cosplaying for 5 years and playing DnD since mid-2019. They are known by their friends as the resident dice goblin, with 42 sets and counting. This is arguably their favourite part of DnD. On TikTok, Robin mainly cosplays their own characters, sharing stories of their campaigns, and sometimes Geeky Clean’s bath bombs.
  • Jake – JasonV131/JakeJohansen673 (He/Him)
    Jake is a UK based D&D player and Game Master since 2017. He also do some cosplay and all around nerdy and geeky stuff. He is no stranger to being a Dice Goblin with about 15 sets of dice, including one metal set. On top of that, he has over 19 DnD books, each one already used in campaigns. Creating characters, places and backstories are his cup of tea. On Tik Tok, he likes to cosplay as multiple original characters sometimes telling parts of stories, and on occasion to provide supportive videos on Tik Tok for anyone to see.

We hope that you will find this panel both informative and entertaining.

Sidenote, to be informed in advance of any of our future panels, events and shows please join our newsletter!

See you there.

Kalum

item.title: The Rolistes Present… "London as a Setting for Your Tabletop RPG Adventures"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Also available in video on our YouTube (please subscribe to our channel). 

Tell me, “How many of your favourite old and new tales epic adventures have London as their setting?”.

Quite a few right?

For this “The Rolistes Present…”,  I am joined by three Tabletop RPG specialists of the “Big Smoke”:

  • Lynne is Associate Editor for Chaosium’s Call of Cthulhu line with experience as editor and writer for Nightfall Games, Cubicle 7, Pelgrane Press, Green Ronin, and Modiphius as well as designer of her own ENnie-nominated steampunk game: Cogs, Cakes & Swordsticks. Chaosium is currently developing the Rivers of London Roleplaying Game, based on Ben Aaronovitch’s urban fantasy “Peter Grant” series.
  • Andrew is a freelance writer who was part of the team of Vampire The Masquerade: The Fall of London and now works on Dune: Adventures in the Imperium for Modiphius. He also previously contributed to Victoriana, Dr Who, Judge Dredd & The Worlds of 2000AD, Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Star Trek Adventures among many others. He also produces his own games as ‘Corone Design‘. Finally, he works as a lighting technician at the Theatre Royal Haymarket in London’s West End.
  • Sean is a lost northerner in the Big Smoke. He is the author of the successfully crowdfunded The London Masters Guide. This book is the world’s first tour book that blends real-life travel with the magical genre of fantasy. As an essential guide to one of the world’s most storied cities, it is filled with curious attractions, macabre history, and legendary destinations.

I hope you will find this panel informative and entertaining.

Please let us know about your own adventures set in London.

Kalum

item.title: Good Ol’ Dragonmeet, 2019 – Part Two
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

Here's our second and final part dedicated to Dragonmeet 2019.

I have especially fond memories of that last edition which was an opportunity to meet under a roof so many people I've grown to appreciate and exchanged so many affectionate gestures.

To close the door on that edition, please let me introduce you to:

  • Becky Annison from Black Armada Games was the second interview of my little quest to meet in person each guest from our "Tabletop RPG between the Channel and the Pond" panel;
  • ...and the above quest was finalised with Dr Lynne Hardy, Associate Editor for Chaosium’s Call of Cthulhu line;
  • Then I caught up with the London RPG Community team represented by Andy, Polina and Jonathan who told me about the games they played at Dragonmeet;
  • Finally, before ending my day at the London Tabletop Industry Network (TIN) meetup, I had long last chat with Matt Jones aka Ursidice, author of many one-page RPGs, who I confused with Cousin Nalesk from Elucubrations Ursidées who I confused with Eric Nieudan (it's been a long day).

Due to Covid-19, there won't be an in-person “London Le Drinks & Dices” this April. I will however look into a way to hold it "online". Everyone is welcome. It doesn't matter if you are from London or not. Keep an eye in our news section, Twitter and Facebook feed for updates.

Take care everyone. Stay safe.

Kalum

item.title: The Rolistes Present… “Tabletop Roleplaying Games As The Lusitanians Do”
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

This episode is also available in YouTube (please conside subcribing to our channel).

This month's panel is the sort of panel that I created "The Rolistes Present…" for.

It offers a unique insight on the tabletop RPG community in a European country and, who knows, might lead to the development of coll future interactions (I am crossing fingers for my guest to join us in London for Dragonmeet in 2020).

To take us to the shores of Lusitania our guides will be:

  • Especuatório/Rubber Chicken Games – Daniel Carvalho (He/Him)
    Published author by Edita-me and RPG writer for Especulatório and Rubber Chicken Games. Member of the portuguese RPG broadcasting platform Rola Iniciativa, and the creator of games such as Asilo, A Dinner to Die For and The Darkest Side.
  • RPGénesis – Claudia Silva (She/Her)
    Started RPing and GMing in 1997. Created and admins the Portuguese RPG Discord Server – RPG Portugal, and admins its sister community on Facebook. Is the creator of the first Portuguese RPG-design jam RPGénesis, which first ran in August 2010. Has been an editor for White Wolf, supplied art for indie RPGs and supplements, as well as written an entire supplement about villains that ended up never being published. Is still quite sad about that. Is Lead Writer for the UK-based LARP Death Unto Darkness. Has created the RPGs “Drama Gakuen”, “Generation Hex”, “Senryaku” and “Phonomancer”.
  • Rola Iniciativa – André Tavares (He/Him)
    André is a producer and content creator at Rola Iniciativa platform, being the most notorious show Roll for Diplomacy where André already interview RPG designers such as Adam Koebel, Luke Crane, John Harper and the Bakers. He’s the co-owner of Maré Baixa, an independent tabletop game publisher, counting with a couple of small games published, such as Tower of Arcana, Dungeon Heart and The Orc and the Pie. André is also the founder of Rolisboa, the Portuguese RPG convention, and ultimately he gives the best hugs.

I renew my call to my panellists, tabletop RPG authors and fans from Portugal to visit us in London for Dragonmeet 2020.

If you are yourself already in London, please consider joining our next monthly “London Le Drinks & Dices” at Bad Moon Cafe every first Wednesday of the month.

Kalum

item.title: Good Ol' Dragonmeet, 2019 - Part One
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

With much less delay than in 2018, we returned in late 2019 to our good ol' Dragonmeet and its #PodcastZone run this year my Mira.

As it is the tradition, I wandered the halls and recorded a collection of awesome tabletop RPG professionals and fans:

  • Mira herself and Rowena Dragon from the Penance RPG podcast;
  • Cat Tobin who was last year on our The Rolistes Present... “Tabletop RPG between the Channel & the Pond” panel and who told us about the exciting plans for "one on one" tabletop RPGs at Pelgrane Press with already released settings and new ones planned;
  • We congratulated Federico Sohns from Araukana Media for the timely release of the excellent Nibiru and bid him a warm farewell as it was maybe his last Dragonmeet;
  • Craig Duffy aka Who Voodoo from LunarShadow Designs;
  • Jay Iles from UFO Press who told us about his "Voidheart Symphony: Kill or Cure" video-game inspired TTRPG about occult revolutionaries waging a psychic war;
  • Peter from the Critical Role UK fan group;
  • Karin Warås from the Chaotic Neutral Twitch stream and Harry from the Dragon Wings podcast;

I hope to meet many of you at our next monthly "Le Drinks & Dices" in Central London every first Monday of the month (next one on ).

item.title: The Rolistes Present… “British Recipes to Succeed With Your Kickstarter Campaign”
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Spotify or Google Podcasts. Sign up to our newsletter!

This episode is also available in YouTube (please conside subcribing to our channel).

Have you ever considered crowdfunding a RPG project of your own via Kickstarter?

“The Rolistes Present…” gathered three amazing professionals from the British tabletop industry to discuss about their experience with successfully funded games:

  • Rowan, Rook & Decard - Mary Hamilton (They/Them)
    One of the three founders of the tabletop game design studio Rowan, Rook & Decard, Mary runs product management, delivery, finance, partnerships and marketing, as well as contributing to the publication of Heart, Spire, Goblin Quest and Unbound, as well as dozens of free RPGs.
  • Black Armada - Joshua Fox (He/Him)
    Josh is one half of Black Armada Games, co-author of the award-winning game Lovecraftesque and designer of Flotsam: Adrift Amongst the Stars. Josh's latest game Last Fleet, a PBTA game about humanity's desperate flight across space from the merciless inhuman foe that destroyed their civilisation, is currently on Kickstarter.
  • The Role Play Haven - Garry Harper (He/Him)
    Garry is a tabletop games consultant with experience working for leading tabletop industry companies such as Modiphius, Mindjammer Press, Red Scar and Games Quest. This included consulting on successful Kickstarter crowdfunding and the production of several licensed tabletop games; Robert E Howard Conan, Kung Fu Panda, Corvus Belli's Infinity, Vampire the Masquerade, Star Trek Adventures, Kings of War and Symbaroum.

As discussed, the Kickstarter campaign for Last Fleet by Josh Fox is LIVE RIGHT NOW! Please consider backing this excellent tabletop RPG inspired by the many science-fiction stories involving fleets of starship desperately trying to escape a merciless threat.

Our next Twitch panel will be titled "Tabletop Roleplaying Games As The Lusitanians Do" and will gather three RPG fans from Portugal. It will take place on Saturday February 1st from 1pm EST (6pm GMT) on the Twitch channel of The RPG Academy.

However, the best way to be updated about our future episodes and live events it to sign up to our monthly newsletter.

See you next month and in the meantime have good games.

Kalum

item.title: The Rolistes Present… Dragonmeet #PodcastZone "So You Want to Start a Podcast!"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Podchaser or Sticher. Sign up to our newsletter!

It was a honour to be invited by this year’s #PodcastZone to run a seminar panel at the Dragonmeet gaming convention.

We dedicated this panel to the increasingly popular endeavour of producing YOUR OWN tabletop RPG podcast.

From RPG discussion shows to actual play productions, we covered them all through the prism of:

  • Motivations for launching a podcast;
  • Approaches to production;
  • Equipment, broadcasting methods and potential costs;
  • Ambitions, goals and measures of success.

To cover these subjects I was joined by:

  • DiDnDnD / PodcastZone – Kat Tulip (She/Her)
    Kat is a data analyst and data protection specialist, a Dungeon Master and one half of DiDnDnD. This YouTube channel explores her co-host’s “Chaos Collectives Alters” through building them as D&D characters and other geekeries. Kat is the Autistic half of this safe place challenging Stigma and embracing acceptance of our own disorders. She is also on the management team for #PodcastZone. Finally, Kat featured briefly on Encounter Roleplay and co-hosted The Pocket Mimic podcast. You probably have heard her before!
  • Power Word Roll – Conrad Leaton Gray (He/Him)
    Conrad is the Dungeon Master for the Power Word Roll podcast. He started playing D&D at 13 and has since run games for strangers in cities all over the world.
    Power Word Roll is designed to feel like a radio play with edited and dramatised 30 minute episodes! Luckily before starting the podcast Conrad worked in radio so knows exactly how to turn a long rambling game into sharp exciting audio.
  • The D20 Future Show – Richard Kirke (He/Him)
    Richard is the host and GM of the actual play RPG podcast The D20 Future Show. When he’s not dreaming up science fiction adventures Richard lives in Bolton and works in the soft drinks industry.
  • Flintlocks and Fireballs- Ellie Sparrow (She/Her)
    Ellie is the producer and social media manager for Flintlocks and Fireballs, a Napoleonic, shanty singing, actual play podcast set on a privateer ship. She also plays their resident disaster bard, and shanty man, Celestia Stardust. Finally, she contributes to Adventurers Wanted as a community manager and moderator.

Thanks again to Mira from #PodcastZone for setting up this panel and to the Dragonmeet team for hosting us as part of their amazing event.

Kalum

item.title: Film Studies – District 9 (Humans Belong in the Monster Manual)
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Podchaser or Sticher.

Our latest RPG Academy “Film Studies” is headed by Fiona from “What Am I Rolling”.

We continue our tour around the world to land alongside a gigantic spaceship in South Africa for “District 9” a science-fictional parabole from 2009 directed by Neil Bomkamp.

As a reminder, for Film Studies, members of the Network sometimes joined by non-Network guests, will review a film and discuss ways it could inspire tabletop RPG adventures, characters or practices.

item.title: The Rolistes Present… #DnD4MentalHealth - Second Panel "Mental Health within Online RPG Communities"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Podchaser or Sticher.

Here's the final live "The Rolistes Present…" panel we recorded as part of our charity event "Dungeons & Dragons for Mental Health" for the charity “Mind”.

Please meet our most excellent panellists:

  • WorldAnvil  – Janet (She/Her)
    Janet is the Co-founder and CEO of World Anvil, an online worldbuilding toolbox software and campaign manager created for gamemasters, authors, TTRPG Players and all worldbuilding creatives. She is also a published fantasy author, purveyor of worldbuilding advice on the World Anvil Youtube Channel, and plays Dungeons and Dragons professionally on the official Dungeons & Dragons channels.
  • World Anvil – Dimitris (He/Him)
    Dimitris is the Co-founder and CTO of World Anvil, web developer, user experience researcher, teacher, lifelong student and passionate storyteller! He loves poetry, movies and lemon pies and used to take photos professionally everyday – and wishes he still had the time to do so!
  • EncounterRRoleplay – Charlie”FrostFrmFire” Smith (She/Her)
    Charlie aka “FrostFrmFire” is a tabletop RPG player and game master on numerous Twitch streams and a community book creator. She is the Twitch Director of the Encounter Roleplay streaming channel which produces many hours of high-quality, diverse, interactive RPG streaming.
  • Critical Role UK Fan Group – Mitesh Lamba (He / Him)
    Mitesh is a London-based Dungeons and Dragons fan, Community Admin for Critical Role UK Fanpage and Community Moderator for Critical Role Fan Club.

item.title: The Rolistes Present… #DnD4MentalHealth - First Panel "Mental Health within RPG Clubs & Events"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Podchaser or Sticher.

It is HERE! Fresh from being recorded just yesterday, it is the very first ever LIVE "The Rolistes Present…" PANEL.

This one took place as part of our charity event "Dungeons & Dragons for Mental Health" for the charity “Mind”.

It gathered several awesome London-based organisations represented by the following panellists:

  • The Role Play Haven - David Coulter (He/Him)
    David is a Senior Occupational Therapist working with people with LD ASD and Mental Conditions. He is also Community Director of The Role Play Haven which is a volunteer-based, community driven CIC. The Role Play Haven supports the local communities and people through many RPG club branches and events across London and the United Kingdom.
  • London RPG Community - Dasha (She/Her)
    Dasha is a stem cell scientist, Dungeon Master and organiser for London RPG Community which runs games across London. This includes the rather unique persistent Dungeons & Dragons campaign persistent setting The Kantas Expanse which accommodates a large number of players and multiple Dungeon Masters.
  • No More Damsels - Naomi Clark (She/Her)
    Naomi is the co-founder of No More Damsels. She organises events encouraging diverse genders to roleplay and DM. No More Damsels also provides safeguarding guidelines and codes of conduct for clubs and conventions. Her projects include a buddy system to help more players over that first hurdle of getting to a game for the first time.
  • The Goblin’s Chest - Rupert Greyling (He / Him)
    Rupert is an artist, author, creator and owner of The Goblin’s Chest. He works predominantly with children and young people who have suffered trauma and live with various mental health challenges. He currently develops, with a South African NFO, a culturally-sensitive RPG suitable for children in local disadvantaged communities.

As a reminder, this event was jointly organised by The Rolistes Podcast and the following all-star team:

  • The Role Play Haven CIC sponsored the event and ran the fundraising initiatives;
  • London RPG Community led the organisation of Dungeons & Dragons play sessions;
  • The Goblin's Chest and World Anvil also contributed to the organisation;

Thanks again to the London roleplayers who joined for their generosity

Kalum

item.title: Better Late Than Never, Dragonmeet 2018
item.description:
Listen & review on Apple Podcast. 

Remember Dragonmeet 2018 seems like it was ages ago right?

Well I guess it was almost a year ago.

My apologies for the delay to release this one.

The good news is that Dragonmeet 2019 is figuratively around the corner so this episode is a most excellent warm up to get you excited about joining us this year in London.

Please meet our guests:

  • Jason Hodgson, an experimental composer from Adventurers & Artists helping out Stuff by Bez;
  • Chris from Darker Days Radio, Adam and Richard from D20 Future Show (with who I played a recorded session of Jason Statham's Big Vacation);
  • Kenneth Hite from Pelgrane Press who returns to our show after appearing back in "Episode 18 (Part 4) Dragonmeet, Right Into The Podcast Zone ";
  • Scratticus from the eponymous Scratticus Academy who invited me to join a "Barn Raising Experience";
  • Paolo Greco from Lost Pages and Daniel Sell from Melsonian Arts Council;
  • Paul Mitchener author of the British contemporary fantasy RPG "Liminal";
  • Sarah Newton from Mindjamer Press who told us about the English publication of the French game "Capharnaum - The Tales Of The Dragon-marked";
  • Fran cosplaying as Jester and Tiegan cosplaying as an orginal character.

I hope to meet many of you at our next monthly “Le Drinks & Dices” in Central London every first Monday of the month (next one on ).

item.title: The Rolistes Present... "Heart - The City Beneath"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Podchaser or Sticher.

This episode is also available in YouTube (please conside subcribing to our channel).

LINK TO HEART KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN

Time to release the recording of our second stream of “The Rolistes Present…“.

It was a great pleasure to catch-up with two absolute kick-ass British game designers.

  • Grant Howitt (he/him)
    Grant is creative lead at Rowan, Rook & Decard. His credits include Goblin Quest, One Last Job, Honey Heist, and Spire.
  • Chris Taylor (he/him)
    Chris is head of systems at Rowan, Rook & Decard. His credits include Unbound, Adventure Skeletons, Jason Statham’s Big Vacation, and Spire.

The duo is joining us to present their fresh hot new Kickstarter campaign following-up the successful Spire and Strata.

Reminder

…it will be a series of LIVE EVENTS driven by a same spirit of community within The Hobby.

The first “The Rolistes Present…“ LIVE EVEN will take place at  "The Rolistes Present... Dungeons & Dragons for Mental Health" at Bad Moon Cafe on October 20th (link to Facebook Event).

This fundraising for the mental health charity “Mind” is sponsored by The Role Play Haven CIC and jointly organised by The Rolistes Podcast and the following all-star team:

  • London RPG Community will lead the organisation of Dungeons & Dragons play sessions;
  • World Anvil who will be there to celebrate the second anniversary of their awesome platform and will also join our panel;

The event will take place all day with the following activities:

All day
Fundraising

This should include different contests and activities as well as a raffle.

10:00 – 13:00
Organised DnD Tables

“Donate what you want” DnD tables with all donations going to our fundraising

14:00 – 16:00
The Rolistes Present… “DnD for Mental Health”

I will be hosting two “The Rolistes Present…” panels centered of mental health, Dungeons & Dragons and tabletop RPG. The panelists will be announced soon.

16:00 – Onward
World Anvil’s Anniversary social gathering and Drinks

Happy anniversary World Anvil! No doubt, we will also celebrate how charity-minded the DnD community is and the heroic exploits accomplished during the day.

See you there.

item.title: The Rolistes Present (Episode Zero) - AcadecOnline "Tabletop RPG between the Channel & the Pond"
item.description:
Listen, subscribe & review on ITunes, Podchaser or Sticher.

This episode is also available in YouTube (please conside subcribing to our channel).

Once upon a time, The RPG Academy invited me to put together a panel on the topic of “Tabletop RPG Between The Channel & The Pond”.

The experience turned out to be such a pleasure that it inspired me to start a new show: “The Rolistes Present…”.

First, it will be a monthly show streamed on Twitch and focused to the RPG scene in London, the British Isles and Europe.

Second, it will be a series of LIVE EVENTS driven by a same spirit of community within The Hobby. Hopefully, I will be able to announce soon a first date and venue for the first o these. Watch this space!

What made this first experience so great was for sure my three amazing guests:

  • Becky Annison (She/her)
    She is an RPG Designer and co-owner of Black Armada Games.  Becky is the award-winning designer of When The Dark Is Gone (part of the Seven Wonders anthology), Lovecraftesque and Bite Me!
    She has written for both Pelgrane Press and the RPG Liminal.
  • Dr Lynne Hardy (She/her)
    Lynne is Associate Editor for Chaosium’s Call of Cthulhu line with experience as editor and writer for Nightfall Games, Cubicle 7, Pelgrane Press, Green Ronin, and Modiphius as well as designer of her own ENnie-nominated steampunk game: Cogs, Cakes & Swordsticks.
  • Cat Tobin (She/her)
    She is the Managing Director and co-owner of Pelgrane Press, former convention director for Warpcon in Cork and Dragonmeet in London. She also founded the fully residential convention K2 and the designer of First Joyful Mystery.

The video of this panel is available on The RPG Academy's YouTube channel.

Another one, on the topic of "Dungeons & Dragons between the Channel & the Pond", was already streamed last month. It should be released soon here as a podcast as well as on YouTube.

The next one will feature Grant Howitt and Chris Taylor. It will be streamed live on The RPG Academy Twitch Channel on Sunday September 8th (1pm EDT / 6pm BST).

item.title: Film Studies – The Neverending Story (Choose Your Own Adventure Gone Wrong)
item.description:
Listen & review on ITunes. 

Once upon time…

...there was a podcaster who dreamt of recording with all of his favourite fellow podcasters…

...and so The RPG Academy “Film Studies was born.

Turn the pages and join Kalum from “The Rolistes Podcast” into a journey through “Die Unendliche Geschichte aka The Never Ending Story”, a West German production from 1984 directed by Wolfang Petersen based on the novel by Michael Ende.

As a reminder, for Film Studies, guest shows are invited by The RPG Academy to review a film and discuss ways it could inspire tabletop RPG adventures, characters or practices.

Our competent academic team is completed by Khairul Hisham from “Hishgraphics” and Senda Linaugh from Gnome Stew, the Misdirected Mark Productions, Pandas Talking Games and of course She’s a Super Geek.

Tabletop RPG settings systems and setting mentioned included:

    • “Tales from the Loop” by Fria Ligan / Free League Publishing
    • “Heroine” by Ginger Goat
    • “Genesys” by Fantasy Flights Games
    • “No Thank You Evil” by Monte Cook Games
    • “Numenéra” by Monte Cook Games
    • “Star Wars: The Roleplaying Games” by West End Games
    • “Microlite20” by RetroRoleplaying
    • “Call of Cthulhu” by Chaosium
    • “BareBones Fantasy Role Playing Game” by DwD Studio
    • “Is It a Plane!?” by Psychic Cactus Games
    • “Buffy the Vampire Slayer Roleplaying Game” by Eden Studios
    • “Katanas & Trenchcoats: Retromodern Roleplaying” by Ryan Macklin
    • “ACTION MOVIE WORLD” by Flatland Games

As it is slowly becoming the tradition, the next film announced by us at the end has changed. Instead the next episode should be about “Don’t Look Know” with a special surprise host at the helm.

Let us know ahead of the recording if this movie inspired you some tabletop RPG adventures and maybe we will discuss your contribution on the show.

Listen, rate or review on Podchaser, iTunes or Stitcher. You can also download the episode.

Please consider contributing to my Patreon, making a modest donation via Paypal or even support your show at no extra cost via your purchases on DriveThru RPG.

Email: Rolistespod@gmail.com
Twitter: @rolistespod
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Rolistespod
Google+: https://plus.google.com/communities/115198268361411183808
Wordpress: https://rolistespod.wordpress.com/
